short_summary: Assistive Voting Technology Development (AVTD): Independent Ballot Verification Application for Electors with Visual Impairments
description: Elections Canada has an obligation to comply with the Accessible Canada Act to remove barriers around voting. They require a mobile standalone (native) application that will allow electors with visual impairments or who are blind to independently verify the mark on their ballot at the polls and in local offices. The objective of this project is to design, build, deliver, and maintain a mobile application that will allow visually impaired and blind electors to independently verify the mark on their ballot using their own device. This application will be used to assist electors with visual impairments or blindness to verify their ballot marks.
full_summary:
# Assistive Voting Technology Development (AVTD): Independent Ballot Verification Application

## Background
Elections Canada is seeking to develop an independent ballot verification application for electors with visual impairments. This initiative is part of their obligation to comply with the Accessible Canada Act.

## Project Requirements
The successful bidder will design, build, deliver, and maintain a mobile application that allows electors to verify their ballot by using their own device at the polls or local offices.

## Security Considerations
The mobile application must adhere to minimum corporate security requirements: Reliability for the Department of Services and the Solicitation Office.

## Period of the Contract
The contract period will begin on the effective date of the contract and conclude on December 31, 2024. The contractor has the option to extend the contract for an additional period of 12 months.

## Tender Submission Guidelines
Tenders are to be addressed to the Contracting Authority and delivered to the Proposal Receiving Unit. Bidders may use the epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation for electronic submission. A detailed bidding guide is included in the tender package.

## Evaluation Criteria
The tender will be evaluated based on a competitor procurement strategy that combines the highest rating for technical merit and price.

## Contact Information
Bidders must submit written queries to proposal@elections.ca. All communications should be directed to the Contracting Authority. Further information can be found on elections.ca.

## Notice
This tender is being issued under the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA) and other international trade agreements.

## Key Dates
* Tender Closing Date: June 27, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. ET
* Expected Contract Start Date: September 4, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: December 31, 2024
